questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph on "The Role of Youth in Building a Developed Bangladesh."

sub_questions.explanation:
The Role of Youth in Building a Developed Bangladesh
Youth are the future of a nation. They are young, energetic, and full of ideas. In Bangladesh, the role of youth is very important for building a developed country. Young people can work hard, learn new skills, and bring positive changes in society. The youth of Bangladesh can help the country in many ways. They can study well and gain knowledge in science, technology, and other fields. Many young people are now creating new businesses, using modern technology, and helping the economy grow. They can also participate in social work, like helping poor people, teaching children, and keeping the environment clean. Youth can fight against social problems like corruption, illiteracy, and unemployment. They can raise awareness about these issues and encourage others to act positively. They can also take part in politics honestly and help build good governance. In education, sports, and culture, young people can represent Bangladesh proudly. They can bring recognition to the country in the world. By being disciplined, hardworking, and patriotic, youth can help the country progress faster. In short, the youth of Bangladesh are the most powerful force. If they work with honesty, dedication, and responsibility, they can build a strong, modern, and developed Bangladesh. A country's progress depends on the energy and vision of its youth.

questions.uddipok: Write an essay on "Climate Change and Its Effects on Bangladesh."

sub_questions.explanation:
Climate Change and Its Impacts on Bangladesh
Climate change is the change in earth's climatic pattern. Increase of temperature and natural disasters are the result of climate change. Due to increasing concentrations of Greenhouse gases, our climate is expected to change even more in the coming decades. Our country is one ofthe most affected ones by climate change in the world. This climate change has a huge impact on our agriculture, infrastructure, and way of life. This is mainly because of the geographical location of our country, making it highly vulnerable to natural disasters. Bangladesh has a flat, low lying landscape, and lack of institutional setup. Climate change is becoming a crucial issue to us and to our government as well. More than 80% of the land is prone to flooding. About two-thirds of our population is engaged in agriculture; so climate change will affect the farmers immensely. This natural disaster brings floods, cyclones, storms, extreme temperature and drought into the country. Mostly, the northern regions of Bangladesh suffer due to extreme temperature problem.
The World Bank warns Bangladesh of becoming the country worst hit by climate change by the year 2100. A WB report estimates that the sea level will rise by 3 feet. This will cause huge flooding, and the failing of crops in the country. This will cause poverty and inflation
So, it can be said that we are already paying the price of climate change. If we don't build consciousness and become aware, we will be in great danger in the near future.
